choices.C: Delete entry 14 because this skill is NOT required within this project

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements apply to the Development skills required section?

choices.A: Delete entry 16 because this should be shown on the Product Description for the photos.
choices.E: Delete entry 20 because this is an expected benefit and should be recorded in the Business Case.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements apply to the Acceptance criteria section?

choices.C: Delete entry 22 because the development of the new company logo is not within the scope of the Calendar project.
choices.E: Delete entry 24 because this is NOT a suitable acceptance criteria for this project.
choices.B: Move entry 21 to Composition because the photos are part of the final product.
choices.A: Amend entry 21 to 'Appearance - 12 photos each showing different members of staff.
choices.D: Move entry 23 to Derivation because the Data Protection Act already exists.

discussion.content:
A. Amend entry 21 to “appearance - 12 photos each showing different member of staff”. This statement is correct because it makes the acceptance criterion more specific and measurable. It also aligns with the purpose of the calendar project, which is to promote staff engagement and recognition.
E. Delete entry 24 because this is NOT a suitable acceptance criteria for this project. This statement is correct because entry 24 describes a requirement that is not related to the quality or functionality of the calendar product. Therefore, it should be deleted from the PPD, as it is not a relevant criterion.
The other statements are incorrect for the following reasons:

D. Move entry 23 to derivation because data protection act already exists. This statement is incorrect because entry 23 describes a security requirement that the product must comply with, not a source product that informs its design.
A - Because the original entry is not measurable?

choices.A: The SLA must extend for the full duration of the service contract.
choices.B: Any changes to the SLA must be managed through formal change control.
choices.C: External consultants are to assist in the creation of the SLA.
choices.D: The selected service provider should be located locally.

discussion.content:
B. Any changes to the SLA must be managed through formal change control.

This is because the web page context mentions that MFH has a quality management system that does not include change management, which implies that change control is a requirement for the SLA. Additionally, the web page context also states that the selected service provider must follow the industry standards for providing outsourced services, which would include formal change control.

questions.question_text: Which is a correctly defined acceptance criterion for the service level agreement (SLA) with the selected service provider?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It is C

The correct answer is D. Add ‘PRINCE2 change control procedures will be used to manage any changes to baselined products’.

The Quality standards section should include the standards that will be applied to the project products and processes. Entry 4 is relevant because it specifies the industry standards for the outsourced services. Entry 5 is also relevant because it specifies the MFH document standards for the project documentation. Entry C is not relevant because it is already covered by the Roles and responsibilities section, where it states that the DIT will check the employment contracts. Entry D is relevant because it specifies how the project will manage any changes to the baselined products, which is an important aspect of quality management. Therefore, entry D should be added to the Quality standards section.

questions.question_text: Which statement applies to the Quality standards section?

choices.A: Delete entry 4 because external suppliers are responsible for applying any relevant standards to their work.
choices.D: Add 'PRINCE2 change control procedures will be used to manage any changes to baselined products'.
choices.C: Add 'All contracts must conform to current employment laws".
choices.B: Delete entry 5 because the lack of a change management procedure makes the MFH document standards unsuitable.
